"Ahh, you're out here as well.":
"Most of the enemies have been cleared out,
but don't let your guard down."

"...Actually, do you have
a moment to talk?"
"Thank you very much."

"I have a question, you see...
It's about Commander Guren."

"Tell me honestly,
what do you think of him?"
"He's strong."
"He's scary."

"What? Well, yes... He is certainly strong.
Moreso than any other ARKS."

"Though that wasn't quite
the answer I was looking for..."

"...So he really does
give off that impression."

"The Commander is not very well spoken, so
there've been more than a few misunderstandings."

"Even moreso while under the
pressure of mobilizing a strategy."

"However, he really does
care for his subordinates."

"In enemy territory,
he always takes point..."

"When falling back,
he is the last to retreat."

"I believe it is his way of
ensuring as few losses as possible."

"It's because of that disposition that
his subordinates hold such trust in him."

"I won't hesitate to say that we put our lives
on the line because we know our Commander has our back."

"That being said, there are certain times where
I wish the Commander made himself more... approachable."

"Particularly regarding
first impressions..."

"Earlier, I asked an Aelio Supply Corps
member on her impression of the Commander."

"She said \"It felt like I was going
to die if I did anything to upset him.\""

"She spoke casually to everyone else, but was strangely
formal only when speaking to the Commander..."

"So I figured
something was off..."

"I'm glad I was able to sort it out
before it led to a bigger misunderstanding."
"She sounds kind of familiar."
"Who did you hear this from?"
"Her name was Xitrae."
"A woman named Xitrae."

"If you are familiar with her, please make sure
she understands when you see her next."

"The Commander isn't scary. He is just a quiet man
who isn't very good at displaying his emotions."

"You are one of the few ARKS whom
the Commander openly approves of."

"I would like to speak with
you in person more often."
"It has been a pleasure."
